revision.text: {{also|ximío|ximió}} ==Old Spanish== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|osp|la|sīmius}}, from {{m|la|sīmia||ape, monkey}}, from {{m|la|sīmus||flat-nosed}}, from {{der|osp|grc|σῑμός}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|osp|/ˈʃimjo/}} ===Noun=== {{osp-noun|m}} # [[ape]], [[monkey]] #* '''c. 1250''', [[w:Alfonso X|Alfonso X]], ''Lapidario'', f. 98v. #*: Et que deſcenda ſobreſta piedra la uertud de figura de oḿe que lieua dos uacas. ¬ un '''ximio''' ¬ un oſſo ante ſi. #*:: And when over this stone descends the virtue of the figure of the man who has two cows, a '''monkey''' and a bear before him. ====Related terms==== * {{l|osp|ximia}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|es|jimio}} [[Category:osp:Primates]]
